intro: Niphobolus koenigii, commonly known as the Indian pennywort, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Saururaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along streams. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Niphobolus koenigii is also valued as a ground cover plant in horticulture due to its low maintenance and aesthetic appeal.
